title: Comment on “Dynamics of Glass-Forming Polymers: `Homogeneous' versus `Heterogeneous' Scenario”

Impact of a clinical scenario on accuracy of electrocardiogram interpretation
Welfare Effects of Spatial Deconcentration: A Scenario for the Netherlands
container-title: Tijdschrift voor Economische en Sociale Geografie
items.abstract: <jats:p>This paper examines whether a deconcentration policy between a core and a peripheral region within a country may increase national welfare. The type of cost and benefits involved and the type of models needed to specify them are first discussed theoretically, and then estimated empirically by means of a comprehensive scenario study for two regions of the Netherlands. The empirical study concludes that a deconcentration scenario might result in net national benefits of several tens of billions of guilders. For this reason a spatial deconcentration policy may well improve the welfare of nations.</jats:p>

title: Scenario modeling for conservation management in the En Afeq Nature Reserve, Israel
items.abstract: <jats:p><jats:bold>Abstract. </jats:bold> Conservation management has significant gaps between (1) collection and storage of biological data, (2) data analysis, and (3) application of results. In order to improve management decision‐making, it is necessary to bridge these gaps. One of the most promising approaches uses computer‐based decision support systems (DSS): interactive models of the system in question—for example, a nature reserve. One kind of DSS is scenario modeling: spatially‐based models which (1) use expert opinion and data on vegetation, geology, hydrology, and management, (2) to project changes in landscape through time, (3) on the basis of changes in driving environmental factors. Scenario models are essentially graphic hypotheses, predicting changes in landscape with a specified change in driving factors, which can then be verified or falsified by monitoring.</jats:p><jats:p>This paper presents an application of this approach to an Israeli nature reserve, the En Afeq Reserve in western Galilee. Our project tests the possibility of improving Israeli conservation management by using methods now standard for nature reserves in the Netherlands.</jats:p>
